description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1a by a later hand. Physical description: 17 lines per page; written in neat naskh in black on glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords; extensive marginal notes. Marginal damp-staining; repairs to first and last leaves. Origin: 9 Rajab 999 H [3 May 1591] in Ardabīl, by Saʻd Allāh ibn Amān Allāh (leaf 221b). Incipit: الحمد لله الذي صغرت في عظمته عبادة العابدين
author: Muḥaqqiq al-Ḥillī, Jaʻfar ibn al-Ḥasan, 1205 or 1206-1277
abstract: Abridgement of the author's Sharāʼiʻ al-Islām.
extent: 221 leaves : paper ; 207 x 137 (122 x 68) mm bound to 207 x 142 mm
title: [Kitāb Mukhtaṣar nāfiʻ].
creator: محقق الحلي، جعفر بن الحسن، 1205 or 1206-1277
subject: Islamic law—Early works to 1800
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
